column4: Good evening, I have been searching forum after forum for a solution to get WPA enabled in my /etc/network/interfaces file with no luck, I have tried 20+ configurations and the only solution I have found is a gtk application named Rutilt and I want to auto connect on boot not have to open an app
I have WPA2 AES
is there a reason why not to use network-manager?
YES
it will not list WPA authentication
oh? i use wpa with NM
odd
can I see your configuration?
i'm not at my normal computer at the moment, so sadly i don't have it available
i set up wpa once manually.. lets see if i still remember how it's done =)
the second to last looks like it's the closest to the right solution
I tried that
I have an application that connects me somehow, when I run it from command line it doesnt give me output of what it runs
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/31208/ try the last one
it leaves most of it to probe =)
thankyou i will try that
if my memory serves me right, it's pretty close to my config that i used
I use wpa2 aes
it shouldn't matter, that should probe the correct settings
how can I debug what is going wrong?
wpa_supplicant throws quite a bit of information to /var/log/syslog
thankx
